A transplant operation is successful only doctors can prevent the body form rejecting &nbsp;the ____ organ .</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. borrowed &nbsp; &nbsp;B . strange &nbsp; &nbsp;C. novel &nbsp; &nbsp;D. foreign</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		<strong>Part III Reading Comprehension (45 minutes， 30 points， 1 for each)</strong></div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		<strong>Directions: </strong>There are 5 p&alpha;ssages in this part. Each passage is followed by 6 questions or unfinished statements. For each of them there are 4 choices markedA， B， C and D. Choose the best one and mark the corresponding letter with a single bar across the square brackets on your machine-scoring ANSWER SHEET.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		<strong>Passage One</strong></div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A 10-year-old boy decided to study judo(柔道) despite the fact that he had lost his left arm in a terrible car accident. The boy began lessons with an old Japanese judo master， and he was doing well. But he couldn&#39;t understand why， after three months of training，the master had taught him only one move.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&quot;Sir，&quot; the boy finally said， &quot;shouldn&#39;t I be learning more moves?&quot;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&ldquo;This the only move you know， but this is the only move you&#39;ll ever need to&nbsp;know，&quot; the master replied.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Not quite understanding， but believing in his teacher， the boy kept training.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Several months later， the master took the boy to his first tournament(锦标赛).</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Surprising himself， the boy easily won his first two matches. The third match</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		proved to be more difficult， but after some time， his opponent became impatient and charged; the boy skillfully used his one move to win the match. Still amazed by his success， the boy was now in the finals.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		This time， his opponent was bigger， stronger， and more experienced. For a while，the boy appeared to be overmatched. Concerned that &nbsp;the boy might get hurt , the &nbsp;referee alled a &nbsp;time-out ,He was about to stop the match when the judomaster intervened.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&quot;No，&quot; the judo master insisted，&quot;Let him continue.&quot;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Soon after the match resumed， his opponent made a critical mistake: he dropped his guard. Instantly， the boy used his move to pin him. The boy had won the match and the tournament. He was the champion.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		On the way home， the boy and his judo master reviewed every move in each and every match. Then the boy summoned the courage to ask what was really on his mind.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&quot;Sir， how did I win the tour&tau;lament with only one move?&quot;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&quot;You won for two. reasons，&quot; the master answered.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&quot;First， you&#39;ve almost mastered one of the most difficult throws in all of judo.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Second， the only known defense for that move is for your opponent to grab your left arm&rdquo;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		31．Why did the boy want to learn judo?</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. He wanted to get over the accident.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		B. He wanted to make up for his disability.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. He wanted to exercise his right arm.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		D &nbsp;.The reason was not mentioned in the passage</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		32.When a referee calls a &quot;time-out&rdquo;__________</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. the time has run out</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		B. the game stops for a short time</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. either side can claim victory</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		D. the game ends in a tie</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		33. Why did the master insist on continuing the match?</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. He didn&#39;t want to give the opponent an advantage.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		B. The boy was confident of winning.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. He had confidence in the boy&#39;s skill.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		D. All he cared about was winning the final.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		34.What probably caused the defeat of the boy&#39;s opponent in the final?</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. Over-confidence. B .Impatience.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C.Inexperience. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; D. Exhaustion.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		35. Why did the master teach the boy only that one move?</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. The boy could not do other moves with only one arm.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		B. It was the only move the master knew well.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. It was the move his opponent would not be good at.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		D. His opponent would be helpless once he made that move.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		36. What does the passage mainly tell us？</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. One can turn a weakness into an advantage.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		B. It is very difficult to have a good teacher.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C &nbsp; Even a disabled person can win a match.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		D. &nbsp;Practice makes perfect.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		<strong>PassageTwo</strong></div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		My five-year-old daughter knew exactly what she wanted for Christmas of 1977， and told me so. Yes， she still would like the pink-and-green plastic umbrella， books， long nightgown， slippers-fine. But really， there was only one thing that mattered: a Barbie Townhouse， with all the accessories.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		This was a surprise. Rebecca was not a Barbie girl， preferred stuffed animals to dolls， and wasn&#39;t drawn to play in a structured environment. Always a make-up-the-rules， design-my-own-world， do-it-my-way kid. Maybe， I thought， the point wasn&#39;t Barbie but the house， which she could claim，for herself， since we&rsquo;d &nbsp;already moved five times during her brief life.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Next day， I stopped at the mall. The huge Barbie Townhouse box was there: &quot;3 Floors of High-Styled Fun! Elevator Can Stop on All Floors!&quot; Some Assembly Required.Uh-oh. My track record for assembling things was miserable. Brooklyn-born， I was raised in apartment buildings in a family that didn&#39;t build things. A few years earlier，I &#39;d spent one week assernbling a six-foot-tall jungle gym from a kit containing so many parts. I spent the first four hours sorting and the last two hours trying to figure out why there were so many pieces. The day after I finished building it， as if to remind me of my limitations， a tornado(龙卷风) touched down close enough to scatter the jungle gym across an acre of field.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		I assembled the Barbie Townhouse on Christmas Eve. Making it level， keeping the columns from looking like they&#39;d melted and been refrozen， and getting that elevator to work were almost more than I could manage. And building it in curse-free silence so my daughter would continue sleeping--if， in fact， she was sleeping-added a layer of &nbsp;challenge .By dawn I was done .</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Shortly thereafter， my daughter walked into the living room. Her surprise may not be real ， but her delight was utterly genuine and moves me. to this day， 34 years later. Rebecca had spurred &nbsp;me to do something、I didn&#39;t think I could do. It was for her， and一like so much of the privilege of being her farther--it brought me further outside myself and let me overcome doubts about me capacities .</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		37.In the author&rsquo;s eyes , his little daughter was_______</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. obedient &nbsp;B. unstable</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. original &nbsp; D. stubborn</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		38 .The author thought that his daughter&rsquo;s choice of the Barbie Townhouse ,________</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A .was natural for a five-year-old girl</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		B．was influenced by her life experience</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C．reflected the change in her taste</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		D．brought her back normal</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		39. For the author， assembling things_______&bull;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. was largely in his blood B. was a challenge he enjoyed</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. was always his weak point &nbsp;D. was part of his family education</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		40. In the last paragraph the author mainly expressed______</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. his pride in being a father . B. his gratitude to his daughter</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. his concern about his capability &nbsp; &nbsp; D. his delight in helping his daughter</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		42. What can be learned about the relationship between the author and his daughter?</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. They are on good terms with each other.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		B. They barely speak to each other.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. They are polite but cold to each other.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		D. They keep secrets from each other.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		<strong>Passage Three</strong></div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		It is all very well to blame traffic &nbsp;jam， the cost of petrol and the fast pace of&nbsp;modem life， but manners on the roads are becoming deplorable. Everybody knows that the nicest men become monsters behind the wheel. It is all very well， again ,to have a tiger in the tank， but to have one in the driver&#39;s seat is another matter. You might tolerate the odd road-hog(占道者)， but nowadays the well-mannered motorist is the exception to the rule. Perhaps the situation calls for a &quot;Be Kind to Other Drivers&quot; campaign， otherwise it may get completely out of hand.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Road courtesy is not only good manners， but good sense too, It takes the most&nbsp;good-tempered of drivers to resist the temptation to hit back when subjected to&nbsp;uncivilized behavior. A friendly nod or a wave of acknowledgement in response to an&nbsp;act of courtesy helps to create an atmosphere of goodwill and tolerance so necessary &nbsp;in modem traffic conditions. But such acknowledgements of courtesy are all too rare today. Many drivers nowadays don&#39;t even seem able to recognize courtesy when they see it.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Contrary to general opinion， young drivers have better manners than their seniors. But this is short-lived in the world of modern driving where many drivers neither expect nor give any mercy. This may be encouraged on the battlefield but is out of place on the roads.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Lorry drivers say they have almost abandoned the practice of signaling cars to&nbsp;overtake when the road is clear, because many of the cars took too long to pass. They&nbsp;couldn&#39;t be bothered to select a lower gear. The car drivers, after overtaking, slow eddown again and hogged the road. Again, a motoring magazine has recently drawn attention to the increasing number of drivers who never wait for gaps.&quot;They&nbsp;manufacture them by force， using their direction indicators as a threat rather than a&nbsp;warning.&quot;Punch-ups(打群架)are &nbsp;quite common. It can&#39;t be long before we hear of&nbsp;pistols and knives being used.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Driving is essentially a state of mind. However technically skilled a driver may be，he can&#39;t be an advanced motorist if he is always arrogant and aggressive.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		43. The author is most concerned about &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. traffic jam B. road manners</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. fast pace of life &nbsp;D. high cost of petrol</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		44. &nbsp;The word &quot;deplorable &quot; (Para. 1) most probably means &quot; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &quot;.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. more serious &nbsp; B. more tempting</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. disturbing &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;D. noticeable</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		45. What is the main idea of Paragraph 2?</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. Many drivers tend to fight back against rude behaviors.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		B. A little courtesy may help ease the tensions on the road.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. Goodwill and tolerance may help relieve traffic jam.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		D. Many drivers nowadays lack a good sense of courtesy.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		46. It can be learned from Paragraph 3 that &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; .</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		A. young drivers are more aggressive</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		B. young drivers would soon lose their good manners</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		C. elder drivers are more cautious</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		D. elder drivers should improve their driving skills</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		47. As you are looking for organic food information, you have obviously become aware that a better alternative exists and you are taking a critical look at the source and production practices of the companies producing the world&#39;s food supplies.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		The purpose of organic food information is to give you an understanding of what is going into your food. You will see that there are many benefits to organic food that you didn&#39;t know before. The basis behind knowing about organic food information is the fact that farmers are resorting to using artificial fertilizers and pesticides(杀虫剂)to control disease and insect attack in order to produce more crops to satisfy growing demand. These artificial fertilizers leave something poisonous in and on the fruit and vegetables we consume which in turn is absorbed and stored by our bodies.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Even the quality of food has gone down in recent years. Today&#39;s fruits have nowhere near the Vitamin C levels they did at one time. However，with organic food information you learn that organic food has fifty percent more nutrients， minerals and vitamins than any other form of produce that has been grown under intensive farming. If you are eating non-organic produce you will have to eat more fruit in order to make up for this deficiency. But then the dangerous cycle continues since you will be eating more chemicals that are worse for your health than they are good for you.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Another aspect of organic food information is the production of &nbsp;meat and poultry (家禽). Most only consider produce when it comes to organic food information disregarding the antibiotics and hormones that are given to both cattle and poultry that are being force fed. Ask yourself what happens to all these antibiotics and hormones when the animal is killed， the remaining of these antibiotics and growth hormones reside in the meat which are then consumed， digested and stored in human bodies. There is no way that an animal that isn&#39;t kept in healthy conditions can produce healthy food for humans to eat.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		You have nothing to lose by trying organic product，not only will it be healthy for you but you will also be able to eat produce and meat the way they are supposed to be. You will likely be so impressed with the taste of organic fruit that you will never return to the mass-produced fruit again. While cost and availability can be a big issue for some，you can do a bit of research online and find a local store that stocks organic produce for a reasonable price.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		49. The idea may sound distasteful，but new federally funded research says more Americans are doing so-whether they know or not-and this reuse will be increasingly necessary as the U.S. population expands.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Treated wastewater poses no greater health risks than existing water supplies and， in some cases, may be even safer to drink，according to a report released by the National Research Council. &ldquo;We believe water reuse is an option to deal with growing water scarcity, &nbsp;especially in coastal areas，&rdquo; says Jorg Drewes， an engineering professor at the Colorado School of Mines. &quot;This can be done reliably without putting the public at risk，&quot; he says， citing technological advances. He says it&#39;s a waste not to reuse the nation&#39;s wastewater， because almost all of it is treated before discharge. This water includes storm runoff(径流) as well as used water from homes， businesses and factories.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		In many places，the report says，the public does not realize it&#39;s drinking water that was treated after being discharged as wastewater somewhere upstream: For example， wastewater discharged into the Trinity River from Dallas/Fort Worth flows south into Lake Livingston，the source for Houston&#39;s drinking water.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		Despite the growing importance of this reuse，the report says there&#39;s been no systemic analysis of its extent nationwide since a 1980 study by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Alan Roberson of the American Water Works Association says wastewater reuse is common, so the council&#39;s report is important but not surprising. Roberson expects this recycling will continue to increase，especially for irrigation and industrial needs. He says it will take longer to establish potable(适于饮用的) uses because of public nervousness about drinking wastewater， however treated.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&ldquo;We have to do something to address water scarcity&rdquo;，says Olga Naidenko， a senior scientist at the non-profit Environmental Working Group. &ldquo;Less than 10 of potable water is used for drinking，cooking，showering or dishwashing. We flush it down the toilet，literally.&rdquo; Technologies exist to safely treat the water，she says， although some are expensive.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		The report says water reuse projects tend to cost more， than most water conservation options but less than seawater desalination(脱盐) and other supply alternatives. It calls on the EPA to develop rules that set safe national standards.</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		&nbsp;</div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		55. padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	　　在在职研究生复习备考过程中，对于学习能力比较强、基础比较好的人是不需要报什么辅导班的。但是对于一部分人来说则有这个必要。不过报辅导班也应该有讲究。其虽有必要，但不可盲目、人云亦云。</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	　　在选报辅导班的时候，学员一定要首先对自己有一个清楚的认识：知道自己哪个学科较强，哪个学科较弱，哪科的基础最差?然后根据自身情况作出决定。如英语最差，可以选报一个全程班，数学成绩不错，可以选报一个串讲班，对重点题目进行巩固和加强等。如此着手，可以使自己在经济上大减负。</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; INSERT INTO `addonarticle` VALUES('5453','143','<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 30px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	　　在职研究生双证哪个更重要?打算读在职研的同学，大部分总会问到有没有双证，或者什么专业有双证件，没有学历是否得不到认可，究竟是是学历重要还是学位重要等问题，就在职研究生双证中的学历证和学位证来为大家分析：</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 30px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	<strong style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; \">　　一、什么是学位?</strong></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 30px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	　　学位是标志被授予者的受教育程度和学术水平达到规定标准的学术称号。对某人学术研究能力的认可，我国学位分学士、硕士、博士三级。</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 30px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	　　学士学位，由国务院授权高等学校授予，硕士学位、博士学位由国务院授予的高等学校和科研机构授予。高等学校本科毕业生，成绩优良，达到规定的学术水平者，授予学士学位;高等学校和科研机构的研究生，或具有研究生毕业同等学力的人员，通过硕士(博士)学位的课程考试和论文答辩，成绩合格，达到规定的学术水平者，授予硕士(博士)学位。授予学位的高等学校和科学研究机构，在学位评定委员会做出授予学位的决议后，发给学位获得者相应的学位证书。</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 30px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	<strong style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; \">　　二、学位与学历的联系与区别是什么?</strong></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 30px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	　　学位不等同于学历，获得学位证书而未取得学历证书者仍为原学历。取得硕士学位或博士学位证书的，却不一定能够获得硕士研究生或博士研究生毕业证书;而取得大学本科毕业证书的，却不一定能够获得学士学位证书。现在经常出现将学位与学历相混淆的现象，如有的人学历为本科毕业，以后通过在职人员学位申请取得了博士学位，这时，学历仍为本科，而不能称之为取得 &quot;博士学历&quot;。</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 30px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	　　在职申请学位不是学历教育。申请人在获得学位后，只表明其在学术上已达到硕士学位的学术水平，具有硕士学位毕业研究生的同等学力(学习能力的&ldquo;力&rdquo;)，不涉及学历。因此申请人的学历并没有改变，也不能获得硕士研究生毕业证书，学历存在一定的意义，但对于更高层次的学术研究能力的硕士教育来说，学位本身比学历更有说服力。西方教育，没有学历一说，完成一个阶段的学习，具备相应能力才能获取相应学位。可以看出学历只是中国教育体系下的产物，学位才是必然的结果。</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 30px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	　　同等学力申请硕士学位、GCT考试等在职研究生考试的方式中，各有优势，比如同等学历是先入学后考试，需要考同等学力英语及学科综合水平全国统一考试，GCT考试是先进行入学GCT考试后入学，很多考生会疑问那怎么能拿到学历，提到&ldquo;学历&rdquo;，首先让人想到的是参加国家每年1月份的全国硕士研究生入学考试。一般要求参加考试者具备大专以上学历，通过考试入学后，进行全日制学习完成学分并通过论文答辩等要求后，就可获得国家认可的学历证书和硕士学位证书。不管怎样，但最终目的无非都是让人们获得更多的专业知识。</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 30px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; padding-top: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 25px; padding-left: 0px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 26px; clear: both; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: 宋体; text-align: left; \">\r\n	　　在职研究生双证哪个重要，学位重要还是学历重要，取决于你读在职研究生的目的是什么，是想提升自己还是晋升需要，还是为出国做准备，结合自身的实际情况权衡自己读在职研与读全职研的利与弊。</p>\r\n','','','59.108.73.73');
